result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay L Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jay L Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jay L Anderson was found guilty of Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine of $250.00 PLUS ALL mandatory  costs, fees and DNA  surcharges to be paid FROM BAIL ON DEPOSIT AND BALANCE BY 2-17-17 or serve 10 DAYS CONSECUTIVE  in the House of Correction.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 2-24-16. COURT OBJECTS TO ES.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay L Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jay L Anderson not in court.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Court will GRANT  expungement  if defendant successfully completes sentence, reports on DITR DATE  and has no further violations of the law.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve FOUR MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 2-24-16. COURT OBJECTS TO ES.

Fine of $250.00 PLUS ALL mandatory  costs, fees and DNA  surcharges to be paid FROM BAIL ON DEPOSIT AND BALANCE BY 2-17-17 or serve 10 DAYS CONSECUTIVE  in the House of Correction. 

Court will GRANT  expungement  if defendant successfully completes sentence, reports on DITR DATE  and has no further violations of the law. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steve Wiechmann is out ill.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM003919  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/27/2016
Defendant is to not commit any new crimes.
Court sets cash bail of $250.00

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Carl Knepel under the student practice rules under the supervision of Kelly O'Neill  for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Dluzak motion to withdraw as counsel heard and granted.  Court orders defendant remanded.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel and sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to Count TWO:

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

On motion of the State, Court ordered Count ONE:  Dismissed. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State filed motion in limine;witness list and proposed jury instructions.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to the amended complaint adding count Two:  endangering safety by use of dangerous weapon(under the influence of intoxicant) pursuant to 941.20(1)(b), 939.51(3)(a).  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case remains on for jury trial in Branch 47. Same bail.
Defendant Jay L Anderson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial  in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case hear off the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defendant qualifies for public defender representation. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession of any firarms or dangerouls weapons.

Defendant Jay L Anderson in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
